items.label: Getting Started with TypeSpec For REST APIs
Managing metadata and visibility in REST API emitters
Cadl to TypeSpec rename completed in March 2023 release

emitters/json-schema/guide.title: Guide
emitters/json-schema/guide.description: When a TypeSpec data type has the @jsonSchema decorator or is declared inside a namespace with that decorator, it is considered a JSON Schema type.

emitters/json-schema/reference/index.title: Overview
emitters/json-schema/reference/index.description: TypeSpec library for emitting TypeSpec to JSON Schema and converting JSON Schema to TypeSpec

emitters/openapi3/cli.title: OpenAPI3 to TypeSpec
emitters/openapi3/cli.description: The OpenAPI3 to TypeSpec conversion purpose is a one time conversion to help you get started with TypeSpec.

emitters/openapi3/diagnostics.title: Diagnostics
emitters/openapi3/diagnostics.description: The OpenAPI emitter may produce any of the following diagnostic messages.

emitters/openapi3/openapi.title: Emitter operation
emitters/openapi3/openapi.description: The OpenAPI emitter is designed to translate TypeSpec language elements into their corresponding OpenAPI expressions. Here's how it works:

emitters/openapi3/reference/index.description: TypeSpec library for emitting OpenAPI 3.0 from the TypeSpec REST protocol binding and converting OpenAPI3 to TypeSpec

emitters/openapi3/reference/js-api/funct.description: Get the OpenAPI 3 document records from the given program. The documents are

emitters/protobuf/guide.title: Guide
emitters/protobuf/guide.description: TypeSpec includes a built-in emitter (/protobuf) that can generate Protocol Buffers specifications from TypeSpec sources. The Protobuf files generated can then be used to create gRPC services or any other tools that are compatible with Protocol Buffers.

emitters/protobuf/reference/index.title: Overview
emitters/protobuf/reference/index.description: TypeSpec library and emitter for Protobuf (gRPC)

emitters/protobuf/reference/js-api/funct.title: [F] $field
emitters/protobuf/reference/js-api/funct.description: Decorate a model property with a field index. Field indices are required for all fields of emitted messages.

emitters/protobuf/reference/js-api/funct.title: [F] $service
emitters/protobuf/reference/js-api/funct.description: Decorate an interface as a service, indicating that it represents a Protobuf service declaration.

emitters/protobuf/reference/js-api/funct.title: [F] isMap
emitters/protobuf/reference/js-api/funct.description: Determines whether a type represents a Protobuf map.

emitters/protobuf/reference/js-api/varia.title: [V] PROTO_FULL_IDENT
emitters/protobuf/reference/js-api/varia.description: Defined in the ProtoBuf Language Spec.

extending-typespec/basics.title: Creating a TypeSpec Library
extending-typespec/basics.description: A TypeSpec library is a package that includes TypeSpec types, decorators, emitters or linters. These libraries are npm packages with some additional TypeSpec-specific metadata and conventions. This guide will walk you through the process of creating a new TypeSpec library, adding types to it, and distributing it on the public npm registry. Further sections will delve into the specifics of creating decorators, emitters and linters.

extending-typespec/create-decorators.title: Decorators
extending-typespec/create-decorators.description: TypeSpec decorators are implemented as JavaScript functions. The process of creating a decorator can be divided into two parts:

extending-typespec/diagnostics.title: Diagnostics
extending-typespec/diagnostics.description: The TypeSpec compiler uses the diagnostic API to report errors and warnings in the specification.

extending-typespec/emitter-framework.title: Emitter framework
extending-typespec/emitter-framework.description: The emitter framework has many issues in its current form and a V2 using a completely different approach is in the works. Use with caution.

extending-typespec/emitter-metadata-hand.title: Managing metadata and visibility in REST API emitters
extending-typespec/emitter-metadata-hand.description: Ensuring consistent handling of automatic visibility and metadata by all REST API emitters is crucial. To understand how these features work, please refer to the TypeSpec-author documentation. This guide will help you integrate these features into your own emitter correctly.

extending-typespec/emitters.title: Emitters
extending-typespec/emitters.description: TypeSpec emitters are libraries that utilize various TypeSpec compiler APIs to reflect on the TypeSpec compilation process and generate artifacts. The TypeSpec standard library includes emitters for OpenAPI version 3.0, JSON Schema, and Protocol Buffers (Protobuf). However, you might want to emit TypeSpec to a different output format. One of the main advantages of TypeSpec is its ease of use as a single source of truth for all data shapes, and the simplicity of creating an emitter contributes significantly to this.

extending-typespec/writing-scaffolding-t.title: Scaffolding templates
extending-typespec/writing-scaffolding-t.description: TypeSpec offers a scaffolding feature through the tsp init command.

getting-started/getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started/getting-started.description: - Get started with TypeSpec for REST

getting-started/getting-started-rest/01-.title: Getting Started with TypeSpec For REST APIs

getting-started/typespec-for-openapi-dev.title: TypeSpec For OpenAPI Developer
getting-started/typespec-for-openapi-dev.description: This guide is an introduction to TypeSpec using concepts that will be familiar to developers

handbook/cli.title: Cli usage
handbook/cli.description: See full usage documentation by typing tsp --help:

handbook/configuration/configuration.title: Configuration
handbook/configuration/configuration.description: The TypeSpec compiler and libraries can be configured either via a configuration file or command line flags.

handbook/configuration/tracing.title: Tracing
handbook/configuration/tracing.description: The TypeSpec Compiler, by default, builds without any debug information. The standard output is minimal, only including any warning or error diagnostics that occur during the compilation process.

handbook/faq.title: FAQ
handbook/faq.description: I'm getting the error Cannot find package 'x' imported from 'y', but I'm not using this package. Why?

handbook/formatter.title: Formatter
handbook/formatter.description: TypeSpec comes with a built-in formatter. The formatter can be used in different ways:

handbook/reproducibility.title: Reproducibility
handbook/reproducibility.description: A crucial aspect of service definition is ensuring consistent output over time. This is important in scenarios such as:

handbook/style-guide.title: Style guide
handbook/style-guide.description: This guide offers a recommended set of naming conventions to follow when drafting a TypeSpec specification.

language-basics/aliases.title: Aliases
language-basics/aliases.description: Aliases are a convenient way to define shorthand for types, especially when dealing with complex expressions. They simplify the syntax but don't have a representation in the type graph. As a result, you can't decorate aliases. If you need to give an alternate name to a model, use model is.

language-basics/built-in-types.title: Built-in types
language-basics/built-in-types.description: TypeSpec Standard Library provide some built-in types that can be used to build more complex types.

language-basics/decorators.title: Decorators
language-basics/decorators.description: Decorators in TypeSpec allow developers to attach metadata to types within a TypeSpec program. They can also be used to compute types based on their inputs. Decorators form the core of TypeSpec's extensibility, providing the flexibility to describe a wide variety of APIs and associated metadata such as documentation, constraints, samples, and more.

language-basics/documentation.title: Documentation
language-basics/documentation.description: Documentation is a vital aspect of any API. TypeSpec offers several ways to document your API, including doc comments and decorators.

language-basics/enums.title: Enums
language-basics/enums.description: Enums, short for enumerations, provide a way for developers to define a collection of named constants. They are useful for documenting the purpose of the code or for establishing a set of distinct scenarios. Enums can be either numeric or string-based. For other data types, consider using unions.

language-basics/identifiers.title: Identifiers
language-basics/identifiers.description: Identifiers are used to name models, enums, properties, and other entities in TypeSpec. An identifier is a sequence of one or more characters that must start with a letter, emoji, underscore, or dollar sign, and be followed by letters, numbers, emoji, underscores, or dollar signs. TypeSpec implements UAX31-R1b stable identifiers with the emoji profile.

language-basics/imports.title: Imports
language-basics/imports.description: Imports are used to include files or libraries into your TypeSpec program. When compiling a TypeSpec file, you specify the path to your root TypeSpec file, typically named "main.tsp". From this root file, any imported files are added to your program. If a directory is imported, TypeSpec will search for a main.tsp file within that directory.

language-basics/interfaces.title: Interfaces
language-basics/interfaces.description: Interfaces are useful for grouping and reusing operations.

language-basics/intersections.title: Intersections
language-basics/intersections.description: Intersections in programming define a type that must encompass all the constituents of the intersection. You can declare an intersection using the & operator.

language-basics/models.title: Models
language-basics/models.description: Models in TypeSpec are utilized to define the structure or schema of data.

language-basics/namespaces.title: Namespaces
language-basics/namespaces.description: Namespaces in TypeSpec allow you to group related types together. This organization makes your types easier to locate and helps avoid naming conflicts. Namespaces are merged across files, enabling you to reference any type from anywhere in your TypeSpec program using its namespace.

language-basics/operations.title: Operations
language-basics/operations.description: Operations are essentially service endpoints, characterized by an operation name, parameters, and a return type.

language-basics/overview.title: Overview
language-basics/overview.description: This document provides a concise overview of the language concepts in TypeSpec. It serves as a quick reference guide rather than an in-depth tutorial.

language-basics/scalars.title: Scalars
language-basics/scalars.description: Scalars are simple types that don't have any fields. Examples of these include string, int32, boolean, and so on.

language-basics/templates.title: Templates
language-basics/templates.description: Templates are a powerful tool that allow users to customize certain aspects of a type. Similar to generics in other programming languages, templates define template parameters that users can specify when referencing the type.

language-basics/type-literals.title: Type Literals
language-basics/type-literals.description: When designing APIs, it's common to define the structure of the API in terms of specific literal values. For instance, an operation might return a specific integer status code, or a model member might be one of a few specific string values. It's also useful to pass specific literal values to decorators. TypeSpec supports string, number, and boolean literal values to cater to these needs.

language-basics/unions.title: Unions
language-basics/unions.description: Unions define a type that must be exactly one of several possible variants. There are two types of unions:

language-basics/values.title: Values
language-basics/values.description: TypeSpec can define values in addition to types. Values are useful in an API description to define default values for types or provide example values. They are also useful when passing data to decorators, and for template parameters that are ultimately passed to decorators or used as default values.

libraries/http/reference/js-api/interfac.title: [I] BearerAuth

standard-library/diags/triple-quote-inde.title: triple-quote-indent
standard-library/diags/triple-quote-inde.description: Triple quoted strings must all be at least indented to the same level as closing """.

standard-library/discriminated-types.title: Discriminated Types
standard-library/discriminated-types.description: TypeSpec allows for the expression of unions and inheritance. However, when transmitting types over the network, many languages require a mechanism to distinguish between different union variants or models within an inheritance hierarchy.

standard-library/encoded-names.description: There is some cases where the name you have in TypeSpec might differ from the name over the wire or for a certain language.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] $format
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: @format - specify the data format hint for a string type

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] $key
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: @key - mark a model property as the key to identify instances of that type

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: @knownValues marks a string type with an enum that contains all known values

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] $overload
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: @overload - Indicate that the target overloads (specializes) the overloads type.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] $projectedName
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: @projectedName - Indicate that this entity should be renamed according to the given projection.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] $secret
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Mark a string as a secret value that should be treated carefully to avoid exposure

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Mark the given namespace as a service.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Assert that the input type has one of the kinds provided

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Check the given is correctly formatted.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] compilerAssert
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Use this to report bugs in the compiler, and not errors in the source code

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Create a new instance of the

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] explainStringTemplateNotSerializable
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: get a list of diagnostic explaining why this string template cannot be converted to a string.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] filterModelProperties
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Applies a filter to the properties of a given type. If no properties

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] formatIdentifier
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Print a string as a TypeSpec identifier. If the string is a valid identifier, return it as is otherwise wrap it into backticks.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getAnyExtensionFromPath
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Gets the file extension for a path.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getBaseFileName
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Returns the path except for its containing directory name.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getDeprecated
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Return the deprecated message or undefined if not deprecated

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getDeprecationDetails
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Returns complete deprecation details for the given type or node

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getDoc
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Get the documentation string for the given type.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getDocData
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Get the documentation information for the given type. In most cases you probably just want to use getDoc

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getEffectiveModelType
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: If the input is anonymous (or the provided filter removes properties)

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getErrorsDoc
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Get the documentation string for the return errors types of an operation.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getErrorsDocData
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Get the documentation information for the return errors types of an operation. In most cases you probably just want to use getErrorsDoc

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getMaxLengthAsNumeric
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Get the minimum length of a string type as a Numeric value.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getMinLengthAsNumeric
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Get the minimum length of a string type as a Numeric value.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getNamespaceFullName
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Return the full name of the namespace(e.g. "Foo.Bar")

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getNormalizedPathComponents
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Parse a path into an array containing a root component (at index 0) and zero or more path

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getOverriddenProperty
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Gets the property from the nearest base type that is overridden by the

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getPathComponents
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Parse a path into an array containing a root component (at index 0) and zero or more path

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getPathFromPathComponents
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Formats a parsed path consisting of a root component (at index 0) and zero or more path

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getPattern
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Gets the pattern regular expression associated with a given type, if one has been set.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getPositionBeforeTrivia
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Adjust the given postion backwards before any trivia.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getProjectedName
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Get the projected name of the given entity for the given projection.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getPropertyType
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Return the type of the property or the model itself.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getReturnsDoc
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Get the documentation string for the return success types of an operation.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getReturnsDocData
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Get the documentation information for the return success types of an operation. In most cases you probably just want to use getReturnsDoc

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] getRootLength
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Returns length of the root part of a path or URL (i.e. length of "/", "x///user/files").

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] hasProjectedName
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Get the projected name of the given entity for the given projection.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] hasTrailingDirectorySeparator
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Determines whether a path has a trailing separator (/ or \\).

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] ignoreDiagnostics
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Ignore the diagnostics emitted by the diagnostic accessor pattern and just return the actual result.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] isAnyDirectorySeparator
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Determines whether a charCode corresponds to / or ``.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] isDeclaredInNamespace
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Check if the given type is declared in the specified namespace or, optionally, its child namespaces.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] isDeclaredType
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Check if the type is a declared type. This include:

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] isDeprecated
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Check if the given type is deprecated

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] isErrorModel
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Check if the type is an error model or a descendant of an error model.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] isGlobalNamespace
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Check if the given namespace is the global namespace

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] isNumeric
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Check if the given arg is a Numeric

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] isRecordModelType
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Check if a model is an array type.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] isService
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Check if the namespace is defined as a service.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] isTemplateDeclaration
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Resolve if the type is a template type declaration(Non initialized template type).

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] isTemplateDeclarationOrInstance
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Resolve if the type was created from a template type or is a template type declaration.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] isTemplateInstance
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Check the given type is a finished template instance.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] isTypeSpecValueTypeOf
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Check if the given target is of any of the TypeSpec types.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] isUrl
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Determines whether a path starts with a URL scheme (e.g. starts with http//, file://, etc.).

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] joinPaths
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Combines paths. If a path is absolute, it replaces any previous path. Relative paths are not simplified.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] listOperationsIn
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: List operations in the given container. Will list operation recursively by default(Check subnamespaces.)

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] listServices
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: List all the services defined in the TypeSpec program

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] logVerboseTestOutput
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Verbose output is enabled by default for runs in mocha explorer in VS Code,

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] mapEventEmitterToNodeListener
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Create a Semantic node listener from an event emitter.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] markDeprecated
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Mark the given type as deprecated with the provided details.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] navigateProgram
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Navigate all types in the program.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] navigateType
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Navigate the given type and all the types that are used in it.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] positionInRange
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: check whether a position belongs to a range (excluding the start and end pos)

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] reducePathComponents
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Reduce an array of path components to a more simplified path by navigating any

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] removeTrailingDirectorySeparator
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Removes a trailing directory separator from a path, if it does not already have one.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] resolveCompilerOptions
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Resolve the compiler options for the given entrypoint by resolving the tspconfig.yaml.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] resolveEncodedName
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Resolve the encoded name for the given type when serialized to the given mime type.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] resolvePath
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Combines and resolves paths. If a path is absolute, it replaces any previous path. Any

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] resolveUsages
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Resolve usage(input, output or both) of various types in the given namespace.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] scopeNavigationToNamespace
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Scope the current navigation to the given namespace.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] serializeValueAsJson
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Serialize the given TypeSpec value as a JSON object using the given type and its encoding annotations.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] setTypeSpecNamespace
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Set the TypeSpec namespace for that function.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] typespecTypeToJson
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Convert a TypeSpec type to a serializable Json object.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] validateDecoratorNotOnType
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Validate that a given decorator is not on a type or any of its base types.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] validateDecoratorParamType
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Validate a decorator parameter has the correct type.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] validateDecoratorTarget
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Validate the decorator target is matching the expected value.

standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.title: [F] walkPropertiesInherited
standard-library/reference/js-api/functi.description: Enumerates the properties declared by model or inherited from its base.

standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.title: [I] DecoratorImplementations
standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.description: Type for the $decorators export from libraries.

standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.title: [I] DeprecationDetails
standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.description: Provides details on the deprecation of a given type.

standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.title: [I] DiagnosticCollector

standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.title: [I] DiagnosticDefinition
standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.description: Declare a diagnostic that can be reported by the library.

standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.title: [I] IndeterminateEntity
standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.description: When an entity that could be used as a type or value has not figured out if it is a value or type yet.

standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.title: [I] LineAndCharacter
standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.description: Identifies the position within a source file by line number and offset from

standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.title: [I] LinterRule
standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.description: Resolved instance of a linter rule that will run.

standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.title: [I] MixedFunctionParameter
standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.description: Represent a function parameter that could accept types or values in the TypeSpec program.

standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.title: [I] ModuleLibraryMetadata
standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.description: Data for a library. Either loaded via a node_modules package or a standalone js file

standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.title: [I] PositionDetail
standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.description: owner node and other related information according to the position

standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.title: [I] SignatureFunctionParameter
standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.description: Represent a function parameter that represent the parameter signature(i.e the type would be the type of the value passed)

standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.title: [I] SyntheticLocationContext
standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.description: Refer to a type that was not declared in a file

standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.title: [I] TypeInstantiationMap
standard-library/reference/js-api/interf.description: Maps type arguments to instantiated type.

standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.title: [T] DiagnosticResult
standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.description: Return type of accessor functions in TypeSpec.

standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.title: [T] EmitOptionsFor
standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.description: Get the options for the onEmit of this library.

standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.title: [T] Entity
standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.description: Represent every single entity that are part of the TypeSpec program. Those are composed of different elements:

standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.title: [T] LocationContext
standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.description: Represent a location context in the mind of the compiler. This can be:

standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.title: [T] MemberContainerNode
standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.description: Node types that can have referencable members

standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.title: [T] MemberType
standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.description: Type that can be used as members of a container type.

standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.title: [T] RuleRef
standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.description: Reference to a rule. In this format :

standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.title: [T] SourceFileKind
standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.description: Type of the source file that can be loaded via typespec

standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.title: [T] TemplateableNode
standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.description: Node that can be used as template

standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.title: [T] TemplatedType
standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.description: Union of all the types that implement TemplatedTypeBase

standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.title: [T] TypeSpecDiagnosticTarget
standard-library/reference/js-api/type-a.description: Diagnostic target that can be used when working with TypeSpec types.

standard-library/reference/js-api/variab.title: [V] directorySeparator
standard-library/reference/js-api/variab.description: Internally, we represent paths as strings with '/' as the directory separator.

standard-library/reference/js-api/variab.title: [V] NoTarget
standard-library/reference/js-api/variab.description: Used to explicitly specify that a diagnostic has no target.
